attributes.action: Keep the current 10-Year Long Residence ILR for those already on track with it
attributes.additional_details: This would avoid disrupting their plans, families, and financial stability. The government should maintain the current 10-year ILR route for those who have been on the track and have less than three years to reach their target. As they came to this country before 2020, they had the expectation that these rules could cover them at that moment. This would ensure fairness and stability.
attributes.background: Changing the current ILR route to one with stricter criteria would unfairly impact thousands of residents who have already been living legally for 7, 8, or 9 years.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petitions which call for similar actions:

Do not apply ILR qualifying period changes retrospectively to ILR applicants 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/751517

Do not apply new ILR rules to those who arrived before 2021 on a 10 year route 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/751924
